metadata.title: CVE-2016-7177 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
epan/dissectors/packet-catapult-dct2000.c in the Catapult DCT2000 dissectorin Wireshark 2.x before 2.0.6 does not restrict the number of channels,which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (bufferover-read and application crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
